customer_addr:
3172 N. Rainbow Blvd #340
Las Vegas, NV 89108

citations.narrative:
There were no records of acquisition or record of animals on hand available at the time of inspection for the pigeons,
geese, or macaws. Complete and accurate animal records must be kept current to facilitate identification and tracking of
animals as well as ensure their health and well-being. Records must be maintained which fully and correctly disclose all
the required information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, transported, sold,
euthanized or otherwise disposed of and shall include any offspring born while in the licensee’s possession.
Correct by 02/12/2024.

There was no visit to the facility premises by the attending veterinarian during the calendar year 2023, which exceeds the
required 12-month timeframe. Regularly scheduled visits to the animal premises allow the attending veterinarian to
assess the adequacy of veterinary care and ensure the health and well-being of dogs. Visits by the attending veterinarian
to all premises where dogs are kept must be conducted not less than once every 12 months.
Correct by 02/12/2024.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection, a written environmental enhancement plan for birds had not been developed by the facility and
made available for review. This plan is necessary to promote the psychological well-being of birds. Exhibitors must
develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan that has been approved by the attending veterinarian. The plan
must be in accordance with the regulations and with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate
professional journals or reference guides.
Correct by 02/12/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There were no records of acquisition or record of animals on hand available at the time of inspection for the pigeons, 
geese, or macaws. Complete and accurate animal records must be kept current to facilitate identification and tracking of 
animals as well as ensure their health and well-being. Records must be maintained which fully and correctly disclose all 
the required information concerning all animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, transported, sold, 
euthanized or otherwise disposed of and shall include any offspring born while in the licensee’s possession. 
 
Correct by 02/12/2024. 
3.13(a)(1) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
There was no visit to the facility premises by the attending veterinarian  during the calendar year 2023, which exceeds the 
required 12-month timeframe. Regularly scheduled visits to the animal premises allow the attending veterinarian  to 
assess the adequacy of veterinary care and ensure the health and well-being of dogs. Visits by the attending veterinarian 
to all premises where dogs are kept must be conducted not less than once every 12 months. 
 
Correct by 02/12/2024. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At the time of inspection, a written environmental  enhancement plan for birds had not been developed  by the facility and 
made available for review. This plan is necessary to promote the psychological well-being of birds. Exhibitors must 
develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate  plan that has been approved  by the attending veterinarian.  The plan 
must be in accordance with the regulations and with currently accepted professional standards as cited in appropriate 
professional journals or reference guides. 
 
Correct by 02/12/2024.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
